alert.note: Alert for Crow Wing (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 12:22AM CDT until June 25 at 3:30AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Crow Wing County. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1217 AM CDT Sunday, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional storms expected overnight tonight may bring another inch or more of rainfall, making any flooding that has developed worse. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Crosby, Ironton, Upper South Long Lake, South Long Lake, Camp Lake, Riverton, Trommald, Woodrow, Pine Center, Cuyuna Country State Park and Erskin Lake. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
